constructor.details: Constructor that initializes the most important configurations.

params._utilityBytes: Utility bytes to be inserted into the transaction payload.
params._versionBytes: The bytes that identify the chain where confirmations are sent + v.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getUnsignedTrx(bytes,bytes,bytes32).details: Prepares raw transacton that was signed by the oracle.

params._method: The function identifier called by the oracle for the confirmation.
params._payloadPart: First part of the transaction; rlp encoded (nonce + gasprice + startgas) + length of the next rlp encoded element (recipient).

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

isBurntConfirmed(bytes32).details: Returns whether burnnt request is confirmed.

isMintConfirmed(bytes32).details: Returns whether mint request is confirmed.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._utilityBytes: Utility bytes to be inserted into the transaction payload.

params._versionBytes: The bytes that identify the chain where confirmations are sent + v.

splitSignature(bytes).details: Splits signature bytes to r,s,v components.

params._trxData: Array of transactions by oracles of 2 elements - payload up to the receiver address and the signature bytes.
Array of transactions by oracles of 2 elements - payload up to the receiver address and the signature bytes.
